page.title: 05MERCASTON METHODIST CHAPEL
page.content: Built in 1827. In Belper Methodist Circuit,Minister lives in Duffield & visits once in 3mths. Seats approx 50. Has 6 members & 8/9 in congregation.Services held each Sunday evening & taken by lay preachers.In May Sankey Service is held to raise funds.Other special services include Church Anniversary, Harvest Festival & Carol Service. Christenings take place.Formerly Primitive Methodist & important in P.M. history as being birthplace of Sarah Kirkland. Convert- ed in 1811 when Hugh Bourne (co-founder) preached in her father's house. First female travelling preacher. First convert was young gypsy who went ahead as herald, announcing meetings. Travelled as far as Hull. 9th June 1816 Mercaston Camp Meeting held in gravel pit. Married twice,buried at Muggington
